description: Formation of vehicular crossover to proposed parking space.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development shall conform in all material aspects with the details shown in the application form and the submitted approved plans, unless variations are agreed by the Local Planning Authority in order to discharge other conditions attached to this decision:Reason:  For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Prior to the use of the vehicular crossover, pedestrian/vehicular intervisibility splays of 2.8m x 3.3m shall have been provided in each direction where the access meets the back edge of footway, and shall be permanently retained free from any obstruction to visibility higher than 1.0m above ground level.Reason: To maintain pedestrian and vehicular intervisibility in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety.

The details submitted for Conditions 8 (Materials) and 9 (Openings) of Planning Permission 19/00699/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory. As such, Conditions 8 and 9 are hereby fully approved.The Council's Design Officer is satisfied with the information provided for Conditions 8 and 9.

The details submitted for Condition 12 (Wheelchair user dwelling locations) of Planning Permission 19/00699/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory. As such, Condition 12 is hereby fully approved.
Please complete and return a Full Plans application form, whch can be downloaded from the following link - https://www.planningportal.co.uk/info/200126/applications/61/paper_forms
Please provide copies of previously approved scaled plans relating to the variation of condition application
Please provide information regarding the amount by which you seek to reduce T.1  by in metres or by percentage.
